stories.text:
Should the US consider a divorce between the states?

We have an inefficient costly system because people are pulling in two different directions and the power oscillation wastes years of productivity when power changes hands.

A phased separation with a scheduled timely vote for the union to continue on a per state basis. If the state doesn't have a simple majority vote to continue the relationship it is dissolved. Second if a simple majority of states in the union votes to remove a state they can.
stories.title: Ask HN: American Divorce

stories.text:
I often find myself working on a project for an entire day and when it's time to commit I spend a lot of time trying to remember what are the changes and what are the new features that I've introduced in the codebase.

I've once tried to make a commit every time I introduce something that should be noted and then at the end of the day squash all those new commit into one, but this felt a bit strange and it required a significant amount of work at the time of merging all the commits' messages into the squashed one.

Can somebody point me out to some best practices for this?
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you efficiently keep track of the changes/features in a commit?
